replies.bodyText: I changed the yaml template file to have the environment variable
replies.author: jshum2479

replies.bodyText: Note that the yamlt template files can handle default macros - you can modify them so that ${WDT_DOMAIN_TYPE} becomes ${WDT_DOMAIN_TYPE:-WLS}.
replies.author: tbarnes-us

replies.bodyText: Once you do that, you don't need to set WDT_DOMAIN_TYPE globally to something else unless going through the MII path...

timeline.bodyText: If we don't use custom overrides for mii, than this function should never be called in the first place when mii is in the picture.  Minimally, it should exit right at the beginning.
timeline.author: tbarnes-us
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -304,6 +320,11 @@ function deployCustomOverridesConfigMap() {
      ${SCRIPTPATH}/util_subst.sh -g ${filname} ${cmdir}/${bfilname}  || exit 1
   done
 
+  # We don't use overrides for MII

replies.bodyText: It won't work if it is not called. The operator has default config overrides which requires version.txt.  That's why I only clean up others to avoid duplicating the block and if conditions ..
replies.author: jshum2479

replies.bodyText: i don't understand.  The operator's 'internal overrides' have no version.txt.  The custom overrides config map has that file, and custom overrides config map should not be set up for the MII path.  In fact, if you add that to the MII domain resource, the domain deployment is expected to fail (since custom overrides aren't supported with MII).
replies.author: tbarnes-us

replies.bodyText:
Yes, we do override--version.txtt  If I don't call this it won't creates it in the location and the introspect failed.
[2020-04-03T16:27:43.390 UTC][][SEVERE] Error: Exiting test due to domainValid from introspecting domain is false!
@[2020-04-03T16:27:39.862 UTC][introspectDomain.py:277][FINE] Printing file /tmp/introspect/domain1/topology.yaml



/tmp/introspect/domain1/topology.yaml
domainValid: false
validationErrors:




"Error, Required file, '/weblogic-operator/config-overrides/version.txt', does not exist"




EOF
replies.author: jshum2479

replies.bodyText: OK. It turns out the test always mounts the config map even though it isn't used, and the introspector takes a different action when it sees this mount.  This is a side effect of the fact that the test doesn't actually run the operator.  I guess this is a fine work-around - we're not trying to emulate the operator perfectly.
replies.author: tbarnes-us

replies.bodyText: Resolving.
replies.author: tbarnes-us

timeline.bodyText:
Several of the tested overrides are internal overrides - all of the 'ListenAddress' and 'Log' related ones.
Maybe we should test those on the model path?
If so, the test needs to be made a little smarter so that internal overrides are tested whilst custom overrides are not.    Perhaps split them into two different "inputt" files - one for internal and one for external.  The combine the files into a temporary file for the PV path, and only copy one of the files over for the Model path.
timeline.author: tbarnes-us
timeline.diffHunk:

 # Check admin-server pod log and also call on-line WLST to check if
 # automatic and custom overrides are taking effect in the bean tree:
 
-checkOverrides
+if [ "${DOMAIN_SOURCE_TYPE}" != "FromModel" ] ; then
+  checkOverrides

replies.bodyText: This will take a little bit more time, I need to take a look of what it is being tested first.
replies.author: jshum2479

replies.bodyText:
More on this.  It looks like the test is not testing 'model updates'.   E.g. the custom overrides from the test  should be passed in as config map updates and tested to make sure that they actually occurred.   So one alternative would be:

Modify the check bean program's 'inputt' file format so that fields that are from internal overrides are tagged to indicate they always come from an internal override.
Modify the mbean checker so that it acts differently in FromModel mode and reacts to the tag differently accordingly.   E.g. the tag makes no difference in PV mode, but in FromModel mode, it expects things that don't have the 'IO' internal-override tag to have the expected value in both the live and the static mbean trees, instead of just in the live tree.
replies.author: tbarnes-us

replies.bodyText: The current test is only one pass, i.e. no update test case.  This is one area that I agreed we should spend some effort into.
replies.author: jshum2479

replies.bodyText: I'm not advocating a second pass.  Just a single pass that includes verification that the settings from the config map took effect, and that verifies the internal overrides took effect.
replies.author: tbarnes-us

replies.bodyText: Yes, it's already there.  The configmap is actually coded in a way that works for both non mii case
replies.author: jshum2479

replies.bodyText: Where's the verification that the listen address, etc, are as expected?
replies.author: tbarnes-us

replies.bodyText: Not for listening address, but the data sources are there.  We can change the override to check the internal ones only for mii
replies.author: jshum2479

replies.bodyText: Please do.  See my original suggestion at the beginning of this thread.
replies.author: tbarnes-us

replies.bodyText: Looks good now.
replies.author: tbarnes-us

timeline.bodyText: When setting up env vars that are very specific to external scripts, consider encasing the entire set of calls into a "(" ... script calls ... ")".  This will make it clear (self documenting) they're scoped only for the external script and will make sure they don't accidentally leak to other calls to the external script in the global scope.

timeline.bodyText:
Right now, by default, this always builds even if a local image with the given image-name/tag already exists - it should probably set MODEL_IMAGE_BUILD to 'when-missing'.  It's my understanding this is the general directive for all tests.
Separately, I've been asked to change the default of this script to 'when-missing' - but I won't get to that until at least next week.

timeline.bodyText:
Please change ")" to ") || exit 1" at line 646 - this is an old bug unrelated to your current change. Otherwise, if the yaml template substitution fails, then the script will keep on truckin' and fail later rather than at the point of the original failure...
e.g. change:
  ( # Generate svc yaml from template
    export SERVER_NAME="${server_name}"
    export SERVICE_INTERNAL_PORT="${internal_port}"
    export SERVICE_EXTERNAL_PORT="${external_port}"
    export SERVICE_NAME=${service_name}
    ${SCRIPTPATH}/util_subst.sh -g wl-nodeport-svc.yamlt ${target_yaml} || exit 1
  )


to
  ( # Generate svc yaml from template
    export SERVER_NAME="${server_name}"
    export SERVICE_INTERNAL_PORT="${internal_port}"
    export SERVICE_EXTERNAL_PORT="${external_port}"
    export SERVICE_NAME=${service_name}
    ${SCRIPTPATH}/util_subst.sh -g wl-nodeport-svc.yamlt ${target_yaml} || exit 1
  ) || exit 1
timeline.author: tbarnes-us

timeline.bodyText: Indent lines 25 and 26 four more spaces.  Right now they line up right under 'For Model'.   Change 'type.' to 'type:'.   Change 'For ' to 'For a '.
timeline.author: tbarnes-us
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -19,8 +19,11 @@ Usage:
     One way to do this when running locally is to run the integration tests.
     (Note that this test doesn't depend on Operator image as of 2018/10/16, but may in the future.)
 (2) Optionally specify values for input env vars (see introspectTest.sh for the list).
-(3) Run introspectTest.sh
-
+(3) For non Model In Image domain type.
+        Run introspectTest.sh
+    For Model In Image domain type.
+    export DOMAIN_SOURCE_TYPE=FromModel
+    Run introspectTest.sh

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: jshum2479
